;;乔治·桑托斯的特写。
;

;纽约共和党国会议员乔治的前筹款人桑托斯周二承认了联邦电汇欺诈指控，这可能会让他入狱两年多。

;
;

;;相关：;;美国众议院投票未能在23日联邦会议后驱逐共和党人乔治桑托斯指控;

;
;

;山姆·米勒 (Sam Miele) 承认犯有一项与冒充当时众议院议长凯文·麦卡锡 (Kevin McCarthy) 高级助手有关的电汇欺诈罪。这一诡计是 2021 年为桑托斯竞选美国众议院席位筹集资金的筹款计划的一部分。

;

;Miele 在 8 月份被指控犯有四项电汇欺诈罪。检察官称，他假装是“一位负有领导责任的众议院议员的高级助手”，冒充这个角色，以便通过电话募集捐款。

;

;检察官还表示，Miele 设立了一个Miele 冒充的人的身份尚未得到正式确认。 ;华盛顿时报;是首先报告的是丹·迈耶（Dan Meyer），他在实施这一策略时担任麦卡锡的幕僚长。

;

;桑托斯坚称他与冒充行为无关。在 8 月份接受美联社采访时，他表示，在得知这一欺骗行为后，他立即解雇了 Miele。

;

;Miele 是第二位与桑托斯有关、在认罪协议中承认联邦指控的助手。上个月，桑托斯竞选活动的前财务主管南希·马克斯;承认有罪;共谋欺诈指控。

;

;马克斯告诉法庭，她曾与桑托斯合作，虚假夸大他的个人财富，以给共和党官员留下深刻印象，希望说服桑托斯他们支持他竞选国会议员。

;

;桑托斯核心圈子的最新认罪进一步提高了这位美国国会议员的赌注。桑托斯已获得保释，他自己也面临 23 项联邦刑事指控。

;

;这些指控涉及他窃取他人身份、使用捐助者信用卡支付数千美元、并向联邦调查人员撒谎。

;

;代表纽约市和长岛皇后区部分地区的桑托斯还被指控向联邦选举委员会提供虚假报告。据称，他告诉联邦选举委员会，他向竞选活动借了 50 万美元，而事实上他在银行里只有 8,000 美元，而且没有发放此类贷款。

;

;这位议员对所有指控均表示无罪。审判日期已定于明年 9 月。

;

;桑托斯发现自己陷入的法律纠纷日益加深，以及他的核心圈子的网络封闭，已经在国会内部引起了政治骚乱。 11 月 1 日，国会议员 ; ;在众议院通过了驱逐投票，大多数共和党人和 31 名民主党人选择等待他的刑事起诉结果以及众议院道德委员会的同时调查，然后再执行如此严厉的措施。

; Wed, 15 Nov 2023 06:52:01 +0800 Ukraine MP linked to Giuliani charged with colluding with Russiahttps://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/nov/14/ukraine-mp-linked-to-giuliani-charged-with-colluding-with-russia
;;2023-11-14T22:34:49Z;
;
;;亚历山大·杜宾斯基 (Oleksandr Dubinsky) 身穿黑色连帽运动衫，站在昏暗的法庭窗户前
;

;乌克兰当局已逮捕了一位有争议的议员，他是 ;鲁迪·朱利安尼;努力挖掘有关乔·拜登的不利材料，并将他置于审前拘留。

;

;42 岁的亚历山大·杜宾斯基 (Oleksandr Dubinsky) 被指控与俄罗斯勾结并传播“虚假”信息关于乌克兰的政治和军事领导层，特别是与他所谓的乌克兰干涉美国政治进程的说法有关。

;

;乌克兰当局于周一宣布了这些指控，周二杜宾斯基在基辅的法庭上出庭受审。会议。随后，这位政客本人在自己的 Telegram 账户上发布了一段视频，称自己已被审前拘留 60 天。如果罪名成立，他将面临最高 15 年监禁。

;

;杜宾斯基现年 42 岁，2019 年当选总统弗拉基米尔·泽伦斯基领导的人民公仆党议员，但后来被开除出该党，被指控不服从命令。

;

;乌克兰 SBU 情报部门周一表示，已因涉嫌叛国罪逮捕了一名议员，并表示嫌疑人涉嫌“为俄罗斯提供信息和颠覆活动”。

;

; >;

;前议员 Andriy Derkach 和前检察官 Kostiantyn Kulych 也被指控参与该网络。据信两人都躲藏在乌克兰境外。

;

;“该组织的主要任务是利用乌克兰紧张的政治局势，在国际舞台上抹黑我们的国家。为此，该组织从俄罗斯军事情报部门获得了资金。这笔融资金额超过 1000 万美元。”SBU 声明称。

;

;2019 年底，在起草针对唐纳德·特朗普的弹劾指控时，杜宾斯基和德尔卡奇在基辅举行了一系列新闻发布会，声称他们揭露了拜登之子亨特曾在一家乌克兰公司担任董事会成员的腐败行为。

;
;

;;相关：;;揭开鲁道夫朱利安尼与乌克兰的迷宫关系;

;
;

;时任总统私人律师的朱利安尼前往乌克兰会见了杜宾斯基和德尔卡奇。朱利安尼正在寻找能够证明特朗普无罪的材料 ;敦促泽伦斯基对拜登家族和乌克兰展开调查;。朱利安尼还希望揭露拜登家族腐败的证据。

;

;2020年，美国当局声称德尔卡奇十多年来一直是“活跃的俄罗斯特工”。 2021年，美国将杜宾斯基列入制裁名单，指责他是“与俄罗斯有关的外国影响网络”的一部分，该网络被指控试图破坏拜登的2020年竞选活动。在美国指定之后，杜宾斯基被踢出泽连斯基的政党，但继续担任国会议员。

;

;杜宾斯基长期以来一直被认为是亿万富翁寡头伊霍尔·科洛莫伊斯基 (Ihor Kolomoisky) 的亲密盟友，伊霍尔·科洛莫伊斯基 (Ihor Kolomoisky) 此前是泽连斯基的坚定支持者他竞选总统。科洛莫伊斯基;早些时候被捕今年;涉嫌欺诈和洗钱。

;

;杜宾斯基否认了所有指控，并表示检方提供的证据要么是伪造的，要么是在压力下获得的。

;

; “现在发生的事情很简单。因批评当局而遭受政治迫害，我在议会生涯中一直在这样做，”杜宾斯基在另一段视频中说道。

; Wed, 15 Nov 2023 06:52:01 +0800 Sundar Pichai denies Google stifles competition at Epic antitrust trialhttps://www.theguardian.com/technology/2023/nov/14/google-ceo-sundar-pichai-fortnite-epic-games-monopoly-antitrust-trial
;;2023-11-14T21:55:23Z;
;
;;Sundar Pichai 于 2023 年 10 月 30 日离开华盛顿特区联邦法院。
;

;Google 首席执行官，桑德尔·皮查伊 (Sundar Pichai) 周二作为证人在他领导的公司与 ;《堡垒之夜》开发商 Epic Games 指责这家互联网搜索巨头通过其应用商店实施滥用、垄断行为。该试验可能迫使谷歌改变其 Google Play 商店的业务和分销模式，该商店控制 ;绝大多数; Android 手机的应用程序下载。

;

;当被谷歌律师问及谷歌是否如 Epic 所指控的那样故意抑制竞争时，皮查伊表示事实并非如此。

;

;“我们的使命是提供信息获取方式，使人人皆可访问并使用信息。 Android 是史无前例的，从来没有一个自由开放的操作系统能够覆盖 25 亿用户。”Pichai 说道。

;

;他的证词涵盖了应用程序的“侧面加载”——从官方 Google Play 商店以外的来源以及 Play 商店的费用。

;

;Epic 的律师向 Pichai 询问 Google 不保留聊天记录的政策，这在整个审判过程中一直是争论的焦点。皮查伊表示，他本人按照指示保留了电子邮件、文档和聊天日志。

;

;詹姆斯·多纳托法官询问 Google 的政策是否允许个别员工通过保留聊天历史记录的设置来确定应保留哪些对话作为证据。皮查伊的回答是肯定的。在 Epic 证明 Google 员工在 Epic 对 Google 记录进行证据保留后无意或故意删除了聊天记录后，多纳托对这家科技巨头感到不满。根据 ;the Verge;。

;

;Pichai 还证实，谷歌向苹果支付 36% 的收入分成，以保持 Safari 的默认搜索功能发动机，每年价值 180 亿至 200 亿美元。前一天，Alphabet 的一位高级经济学家在证人席上透露了这一数字，谷歌一直试图对这一数字保密。

;

;Epic 是 ;指控;谷歌“非法垄断Android应用分发市场”，以扼杀消费者选择、向开发者收取费用并阻止竞争对手公司推出自己的应用程序商店。谷歌否认有任何不当行为，称其在 Android 下载量方面的主导地位是成功的商业实践以及与苹果应用商店竞争的结果。这也是反起诉; 史诗般的违约行为。

;
;

;;相关：;;谷歌垄断互联网搜索十年，具有里程碑意义的反垄断审判开庭;

;
;

;上周开始的陪审团审判在旧金山联邦法院，这是谷歌最近的另一场备受瞩目的法律诉讼，因为它面临着对其长期商业模式和市场主导地位的挑战。该公司目前正在司法部提起的另一项反垄断审判中为自己辩护，该审判指控谷歌非法建立了对互联网搜索和网络广告的垄断。在那次审判中，政府检察官于 10 月底;对皮查伊提出质询;，迫使首席执行官证明 Google 与 Apple 等公司价值数十亿美元的合作关系合理，使其成为设备上的默认搜索引擎。

;

;Epic 的律师辩称，Google 的 Play 商店 - 需要 ;Android 上基于订阅的应用购买可享受 15% 的折扣;，或 30% 的折扣对于每年从这些购买中获得超过 10 万美元收入的开发商来说，他们创建了一个系统，开发商必须向谷歌付款，否则就会被排除在市场之外。在审判期间，Epic 的律师还声称 Google ;协商了特殊协议< /a>; 与 Spotify 等服务合作以维持业务，但从未与 Epic 合作。 Epic 的投诉称，谷歌还;与动视等开发商达成了协议;，以阻止他们创建自己的应用商店，从而进一步限制竞争。

;

;在审判的第一周，Epic 的律师表示 Google 试图通过删除内部聊天记录来掩盖科技巨头的商业行为并隐藏潜在的证据。在该案件的;一项证物;中，皮查伊似乎请求关闭公司群组的聊天记录设置。多纳托今年早些时候裁定 Google ;应因未能保留证据而受到制裁，正如诉讼保留所要求的那样。 Epic 的律师还提交了负责监督与 Android 设备制造商合作关系的 Google 高管 James Kolotouros 的声明，他在一份记事本文件中抱怨该公司的工作，其中包括一份质问：“我为什么要为这些人辩护？”
;< br>; “Android 领导层缺乏诚实。当面撒谎，在背后捅你一刀，”Kolotouros 的文件中写道，;据 The Verge; 报道。

;

;Epic 于 2020 年首次提起诉讼， Google 和 Apple 均;移除了《堡垒之夜》;从他们的应用程序商店。此次删除是由于 Epic 在《堡垒之夜》中推出新的支付系统而引发的争议，该系统试图避免应用商店向开发者收取的佣金。 Epic 对苹果发起了类似诉讼，并于 2021 年开庭审理，指控该公司的应用商店违反了反垄断法，但裁决基本上站在了苹果一边，并发现这家 iPhone 制造商并未拥有不公平的垄断地位。然而，法院确实裁定苹果违反了加州的不公平竞争法。与 Epic 与谷歌的审判不同，苹果的审判没有陪审团，仅由一名法官做出裁决。 Apple 和 Epic 都有 ;请求最高法院;受理此案。

;

;Epic 并未在针对 Google 的案件中寻求任何金钱损失，该案件预计将于明年某个时候做出裁决。 Epic 的首席执行官 Tim Sweeney 预计也会在未来几周内出庭作证。

;

;Google 和 Epic 拒绝就本文的记录置评。

; Wed, 15 Nov 2023 06:22:01 +0800 Woman who fled Saudi Arabia with daughter wins court battle to stay in UShttps://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/nov/14/saudi-arabia-activist-daughter-custody-us
;;2023-11-14T22:08:53Z;
;
;;Bethany Alhaidari 摄于九月。法院的裁决标志着一场漫长而激烈的监护权争夺战可能结束。
;

;美国一家法院裁定，一名美国活动人士;2019 年带着女儿逃离沙特阿拉伯; 将被允许无视沙特监护令并留在该国与她的孩子在一起，因为如果她返回王国，她将面临被处决的严重风险。

;

;此案是沙特首次规定儿童监护权以及对女性使用死刑活动人士已在美国法院面临判决。

;

;华盛顿州上诉法院发现，有“充分证据”支持下级法院的结论，贝瑟尼·阿尔海达里 (Bethany Alhaidari) 将面临死刑，其女儿扎伊娜 (Zaina) 是美国公民。如果她因为宗教和政治信仰而返回沙特阿拉伯。

;

;“华盛顿法院无需执行另一个国家的儿童监护权法令，并且可以在外国法律规定的情况下对监护权行使管辖权法官写道：“‘叛教’可被判处死刑。”

;

;他们还发现，贝瑟尼·阿尔海达里 (Bethany Alhaidari) 在沙特阿拉伯居住期间签署的监护权协议是在胁迫下达成的。

;
;

;;相关：;;逃离沙特阿拉伯的美国活动人士冒着被迫送回孩子的风险;

;
;

;华盛顿州上诉法院的裁决标志着漫长而痛苦的事件可能结束贝瑟尼·阿尔海达里 (Bethany Alhaidari) 和她的沙特前夫加桑·阿卜杜拉赫曼·阿尔海达里 (Ghassan Abdulrahman Alhaidari) 之间的监护权之争。在法庭记录中，贝瑟尼声称曾受到当时的丈夫的言语和身体虐待（后者否认了这些指控），并表示在夫妻离婚后，她被剥夺了对女儿的权利。

;

;在他们的监护期间打架后，加桑发布了贝瑟尼穿着比基尼练习瑜伽的照片，导致她因公共猥亵和扰乱公共秩序而受到调查。他还指控她通奸，因为她有一个男性朋友，并指控她侮辱伊斯兰教，这种罪行在王国境内可判处死刑。

;

;作为她的法定监护人，贝瑟尼需要她的前男友丈夫允许她带着女儿离开沙特阿拉伯。

;

;Alhaidari 制定了一个离开沙特阿拉伯的计划，其中包括向她的前夫道歉并假装再次爱上他。

;

;她告诉《卫报》，这种虚假的关系持续了几个月，直到她重新获得他的信任并获得他的许可，带着女儿离开王国返回美国。

;

;一旦她抵达后，阿尔海达里向华盛顿州申请紧急管辖权。由于美国执行外国监护令 — — 如果监护案件中存在严重人权问题则有例外 — — 由美国法院来决定 Alhaidari 和她的女儿是否可以留下来。与此同时，Alhaidari 成为代表沙特阿拉伯监狱中的个人的直言不讳的活动家。

;

;Alhaidari 还游说修改华盛顿州法律，允许该州的监护法院无视外国的裁决。当该国法律禁止“叛教”（即放弃先前的宗教信仰）并以死刑惩罚此类“罪行”时，该国拥有管辖权。

;

;上诉法院最终在其裁决中引用了修订后的监护权法。

;

; p>;

;Alhaidari 表示，周二的决定后，她感到“无比轻松”。

;

;“我非常感谢所有提供帮助的人。立法者、我的法律团队，还有那些在我们脱身过程中为我们提供帮助的沙特人，”她说。

;

;“我有点震惊。这种情况已经持续了好几年……我不知道如果没有法律的改变我们会怎么样。”

; Wed, 15 Nov 2023 06:22:01 +0800 Pelosi attacker planned to wear unicorn costume and post interrogation onlinehttps://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2023/nov/14/aul-pelosi-attacker-david-depape-testimony
;;2023-11-14T21:01:00Z;
;
;;一名年轻的白人男子，留着金色长胡子和金色长发。
;

;被指控的男子去年用锤子袭击美国前众议院议长南希·佩洛西的丈夫的事件周二在联邦审判中告诉陪审员，他如何前往佩洛西位于旧金山的家，作为结束美国腐败的更大计划的一部分。戴维·德帕普 (David DePape) 发表了一个多小时的讲话，在读完有关前总统唐纳德·特朗普 (Donald Trump) 的 YouTube 视频的评论后，他经常因自己的政治倾向如何从左翼转向右翼而激动不已并哭泣。他说，他去了佩洛西斯家，与她谈论俄罗斯参与 2016 年大选的事情，并计划穿上充气独角兽服装，并将对她的审讯上传到网上。

;
;

;< span>;相关：;; “创伤性”：保罗·佩洛西作证称自己被男子用锤子袭击;

;
;

;检察官表示，德帕普在 2022 年 10 月 28 日凌晨殴打了保罗·佩洛西，就在中期选举前几天，并且他身上有绳子和拉链。

;

;;拉丁裔男子坐在棕色沙发上微笑，涂红色唇膏，红色领带，黑色西装外套，白衬衫，彩虹别针.
;

;在墨西哥选举法庭柔和的米色背景下，赫苏斯·奥西尔·巴埃纳 (Jesús Ociel Baena) 容光焕发。 The non-binary magistrate paired a shirt and tie with colorful skirts, high heels and bright red lipstick. In the heat of Aguascalientes state, Baena, who used they/their pronouns, would theatrically brandish a rainbow fan to cool down.

;

;Proudly out in the courtroom, the classroom and on social media, Baena was a beacon for Mexico's queer population, and their death this week has sent shock waves through an embattled community.

;

;“I'm a trans man and Ociel meant visibility and strength for me,” said Karim García. “Ociel gave me the courage to show the world who I am.”

;
;

;;Related: ;;Mexico's first openly non-binary magistrate found dead at home;

;
;

;At a demonstration honoring the magistrate on Monday night, García held high a hand-painted drawing of Baena with their rainbow hand fan. “We demand justice!” it read.

;

;Officials said that Baena's body had been found at home, along with that of another person, whom local media identified as Baena's partner.

;

;In protests across the country on Monday night, LGBTQ+ Mexicans rejected the government's initial claims that Baena died over a “personal matter” and suggested that their death was fueled by the hate, discrimination and violence the community routinely faces.

;

;Thousands marched along Mexico City's Reforma Avenue chanting “Justice” and “Crime of passion? National Lie!” They waved rainbow, trans and non-binary flags and whipped rainbow hand fans in the air.

;

;Similar demonstrations were held in other cities including Monterrey, Puebla and Baena's hometown, Aguascalientes.

;

;“This is a painful loss for our community,” said García. “Having people in government who represent us means so much because we haven't had that.”

;

;Baena was a magistrate at the Aguascalientes State Electoral Institute and a professor at the Autonomous University of Aguascalientes. They pushed linguistic boundaries by rejecting the gendered Spanish word endings, which code nouns as male or female.

; ;

;Baena used the term ;le magistrade; instead of the male-gendered ;el magistrado;, and in October 2022 they became the first person in Mexico and Latin America to be granted a non-binary magistrate title. In May 2023, Mexico's Foreign Relations Ministry granted Baena ;the country's first non-binary passport;. Just three weeks ago, Baena received the first “;maestre;”, or non-gendered professor, title in electoral law.

;

;“Ociel being a public servant was one of the most tangible pieces of evidence of the progress we've made,” said Enrique Torre Molina, an activist and co-founder of the LGBTQ+ organization Colmena 41.

;

;“It was also a win for the LGBTQ+ movement, which has found ways to make friends and allies in government,” said Torre Molina, who has worked as a diversity consultant for the federal government. “But I believe the LGBTQ+ community is not finding enough support from the highest levels of government.”

;

;Mexico's queer community is particularly outraged at what they see as a rush to conclusions by authorities investigating Baena's death.

;
;
;

;Having people in government who represent us means so much because we haven't had that

;
; ;Karim García;
;
;
;

;Hours after Baena and their partner were found dead, the Aguascalientes state attorney general, Jesús Figueroa Ortega, said both victims where found holding razor blades, which presumably caused their wounds.

;

;“There were no prints of a third party inside the home and the front door was locked,” said Figueroa in a press conference. “The two people arrived around 1.00am. Upon reviewing security cameras, no one else entered the house before or after.”

;

;He also said that investigators found blood on the bed and bloody footprints leading through the home.

; ;

;From 2018-2022, LGBTQ+ rights group Letra S documented 453 murders in the community but said the actual number is likely much higher. Trans people were the most common victims, including ;13 in the first five months of 2023;.

;

;Alejandro Brito, director of Letra S, said that Baena's visibility on social media made them a target and urged authorities to take that context into consideration in their investigation.

;

;“They were a person who received many hate messages, and even threats of violence and death, and you can't ignore that in these investigations,” Brito said.

;

;Baena's supporters have also received threats. One shared comments they received while livestreaming a response to Baena's death on TikTok.

;

;“What happened to the magistrate is going to happen to you,” a commenter wrote.

;

;One of Baena's last public appearances was ;a video; posted on social media. Dressed in heels, a long skirt and bright red lipstick, they acted out a skit about how the state electoral board was reserving positions for the LGBTQ+ community, people with disabilities and people over age 60.

;

;“Remember, LGBTQ+ gang,” Baena says in a flirty voice, fanning themself with a rainbow hand fan. “You must sign up because being a part of the electoral authority is your political-electoral right.”

;

;“We need to take over the electoral authority office or go after Ociel Baena,” wrote one commenter.

;

;Another started a petition demanding “that degenerate” Ociel Baena remove the video.

;

;“I will not take down my post!” Baena responded.

;

;A former Scotland Yard intelligence chief should face a new investigation into alleged perjury, the mother of Stephen Lawrence has said, after the unearthing of documents claiming he was corrupt.

;

;The concerns centre around former Metropolitan police commander Ray Adams, a senior officer in the area where Lawrence was stabbed to death in 1993. The BBC says a Met document from 2000 shows officers concluding Adams was corrupt.

;

;The conclusion follows claims by an informant. The Met document contains claims Adams was cleared by a police corruption inquiry in the 1980s after false evidence was given by a man linked to the family of one of Lawrence's killers.

;

;Adams denied all wrongdoing and said he played only a minor role in the first flawed Lawrence murder investigation, which led to his killers escaping justice for nearly two decades.

;

;Imran Khan KC, the solicitor for Doreen Lawrence, said: “We believe there may be grounds for two criminal investigations for perjury or perverting the course of justice as result of this document.

;

;“The first is about the witness allegedly providing false testimony. The second is whether Adams told the truth at the Macpherson inquiry, about who he knew, and about corruption.”

;

;Adams was questioned at the 1998 Macpherson public inquiry into the failings that let Lawrence's killers escape justice, in which he denied all wrongdoing.

;

;Police said they would explore detail about the new claims before deciding whether any investigation was merited.

;

;Khan added: “Baroness Lawrence has said that no officer has ever been held to account for their failures. This is an opportunity for a former officer to be held accountable.

;

;“If the Met want to recover trust and confidence, this is the opportunity for commissioner Sir Mark Rowley to take action, where there appear to be reasonable lines of inquiry.”

;

;Bob Quick, former head of anti-corruption at the Met, said: “Adams was under suspicion at a number of points in his career, and particularly towards the end. After he left, his name surfaced in a number of corruption operations. Intelligence was available but not the hard evidence for a prosecution.”

;

;The Met said past inquiries had unearthed no evidence of wrongdoing: “The independent officer for police conduct has also carried out a separate inquiry into whether in 1998, senior officers in the MPS did not disclose all relevant information about allegations of corruption to the Macpherson inquiry. This inquiry may also have relevance to the allegations referenced in the BBC's report.

;

;“The IOPC found no indication that any officer may have committed a criminal offence.

;

;“The Met's directorate of professional standards will be writing to the BBC to request access to any material in their possession that supports allegations of police corruption. We will review such material, alongside the outcomes of the above IOPC investigations and any previous relevant anti-corruption investigations conducted by the Met, to determine whether any further action is required.”

;

;After retiring from the Met in August 1993 for medical reasons, Adams was hired by Rupert Murdoch's NDS company.

;

;A government-ordered review into longstanding claims corruption had shielded Lawrence's killers, conducted by barrister Mark Ellison KC, said: “Adams was the subject of two major corruption allegations during his service with the [Met] … In addition, Adams was the subject of 11 other complaints between 1965 and 1985 all of which were either unsubstantiated, withdrawn or not proceeded with.

;

;“The position regarding Mr Adams, as we have found it in this review, is substantially as it was at the time of the Stephen Lawrence inquiry – there is no evidence providing any reasonable grounds for suspecting that he acted corruptly in the Lawrence murder investigation.”

;

;The Guardian reported on the questions surrounding Adams, now 81, in 2012. He has always maintained his innocence.
